intro: Spiesia melanotricha, commonly known as the black-haired spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and distinctive floral structures. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often covered with fine, soft hairs. The flowers are small and inconspicuous, with male and female flowers usually occurring on separate plants.
